The gains of this agreement have brought peace to the island of Ireland for 25 years, and we must continue our work to protect and strengthen these gains for future generations to enjoy.
As a guarantor of the agreement, the US has the indispensable role of continuing to uphold the principles embodied in the peace accord, ensuring no return to a hard border.

Today, on this distinguished occasion, we must remember that the GFA can and should be used as a template for peace around the world. Two generations have now grown up not knowing the violence of the Troubles or living with a hard border.

25 years ago, the governments of Ireland and the UK signed the Good Friday Agreement, marking the end of the longest period of conflict in Irish history. Everyone involved acted together in good faith, with both parties giving up something to reach this agreement.
